channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Eye test on Leicestershire girl, 11, led to brain tumour discovery
item.description: Grace, from Great Glen, was diagnosed the day before she was due to start secondary school.

item.title: Red Bull in trademark dispute with English gin firm Bullards.
item.description: The Austrian energy drink company is pursuing a legal challenge over the use of word "bull".

item.title: US politician Nancy Pelosi heads to Chorley, Lancashire for G7 summit
item.description: The Lancashire town is hosting a meeting of presiding officers - including the US Speaker of the House.

item.title: 'Dachshund disco is a children's party for your dog'
item.description: Organisers James Morgan and Anushka Fernando want to help dogs socialise again after lockdown.

item.title: Bristol strip clubs to stay open despite proposed ban
item.description: Bristol councillors pass two strip club licensing renewal application despite numerous objections.

item.title: Derbyshire school friends MBE row ends in £21m shares ruling
item.description: Adrian Fewings was awarded an MBE for services to business and the community in 2018.

item.title: Mutiny on the Bounty captain's watch auctioned
item.description: William Bligh was famously overthrown by a rebel crew in the South Pacific in 1789.

item.title: Everybody's Talking About Jamie: Sheffield welcomes home coming-of-age story
item.description: Jamie Campbell salutes Sheffield's role in the story of his extraordinary life.

item.title: Infection known as mad cow disease found on Somerset farm
item.description: Officials say there is no current risk to public health from the infection, known as mad cow disease.

item.title: How West Yorkshire influences the fashion world
item.description: From breathtaking moors to Yorkshire wit, an exhibition explores the county's impact on style.

item.title: Abdirahim Mohamed: Fourth murder charge in Leicester stab probe
item.description: A total of six men have now been charged in connection with 18-year-old Abdirahim Mohamed's death.

item.title: Trio who stole car and almost drove off with toddler sentenced
item.description: Three men admit dragging a woman from her car at knifepoint and almost driving off with her son.

item.title: Salford woman shares photographs of eczema flare-ups
item.description: Kymmene Dawson shares photographs of stages of eczema flare-ups to raise awareness of the condition.

item.title: Manchester music cafe brings joy to people with dementia
item.description: People with dementia sing, play instruments and dance at the music cafe, says Manchester Camerata.

item.title: Sheringham 125-year-old shipwreck revealed by calm weather
item.description: The sunken vessel is rarely seen due to ever-changing conditions at sea.

item.title: Digbeth scene hopes to see street art across Birmingham
item.description: The Digbeth street culture festival is back - with a dream to see artwork across Birmingham.

item.title: Education in prison: 'If I can do it, anyone can’
item.description: Two prisoners describe how their education inside took them on a different path.

item.title: Cullercoats Watch House in urgent need of repair
item.description: Trustees of the Grade II-listed building are also seeking ways to bring it back into community use.

item.title: Mother of boy killed by dog in Cornwall 'truly sorry'
item.description: Frankie Macritchie asked his mum to leave the dog when she went to check on him, an inquest hears

item.title: 'Unprecedented' seabird deaths on northern coasts a mystery
item.description: Hundreds of birds are found dead or starving off the coasts of north-east England and Scotland.

item.title: Manchester Metrolink: Man who fell between trams has leg amputated
item.description: The man, who fell between two linked trams in Manchester, remains in a critical condition.

item.title: M25 protests: Priti Patel calls activists 'selfish'
item.description: Further protests are taking place on the London orbital motorway, as well as the M1, M3 and M11.

item.title: G7 Carbis Bay Hotel ordered to remove meeting rooms
item.description: The rooms were built without planning permission ahead of the G7 summit in Cornwall in June.

item.title: Six jailed after Watford car chase killing of Luke O'Connell
item.description: The group used a samurai sword, machete and wrench in an attack on three people in a car.

item.title: Europa League: Fans arrested over Leicester City v Napoli violence
item.description: Nine men are detained after Leicester City and Napoli supporters clash.

item.title: Sarina Wiegman gives glimpse of England future with 'OK' performance in 8-0 win
item.description: Sarina Wiegman's England tenure started with an 8-0 thrashing of North Macedonia but she still demanded more.

item.title: Steve Bruce: Newcastle boss battles on after 'difficult' night against Leeds
item.description: Newcastle boss Steve Bruce admits he faced a "difficult" night against Leeds when fans turned on him.

item.title: Derby County: Championship club file notice to appoint administrators
item.description: Derby County will go into administration amid continued financial problems and face a 12-point deduction.

item.title: T20 Blast Finals Day: Who will be victorious in all-southern affair?
item.description: Sussex Sharks, Hampshire Hawks, Somerset and Kent Spitfires head to Edgbaston in a bid to be crowned T20 Blast champions.

item.title: Lozowski kicks Saracens to win at Bristol on Premiership return
item.description: Fly-half Alex Lozowski kicks 21 points as promoted Saracens win 26-9 at Bristol Bears on their return to the Premiership.
